intro: Chamaesyce hirta f. glaberrima, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It is a member of the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and its preference for moist, sandy soils. It typically grows in open habitats such as disturbed areas and forest edges. Its foliage is generally glabrous, meaning it lacks hair, which distinguishes it from other members of the species.
